page.title: 09DR. WILLIAM CAREY, MINISTER
page.content: Carey was born in Northamptonshire on August 17th 1761. He was the eldest son of 5 children of a weaver, who later became a parish clerk. When Carey left school he worked as a farm labourer, but a painful skin disease caused by exposure to the sun made him look for an inside job. Carey was apprenticed to a cordvainer (a craftsman who made shoes)named Clark Nicholls. Clake helped Carey with his studies of Greek out of a New Testament Commentary book in Greek. On 10th June 1781, just before Carey was 20, he married Dorothy Plackett. In 1785 Carey moved to Moulton with his family. In 1786 he was appointed Baptist Pastor in Moulton. In 1789 he was made Pastor of Harvey Lane Chapel in Leicester. Now Carey lead a busy life of shoemaking, continuing Bible studies and preaching in the village churches.
